title: The Digital Reaper
description: Three connected deaths over one week. A corporate lawyer, a journalist, and a police detective. All died under mysterious circumstances with signs of sophisticated cyber intrusion. Someone is using technology as a weapon.

victim.name: Marcus Chen
victim.background: Corporate lawyer known for defending white-collar criminals. Recently won a case that let a corrupt CEO walk free.

victim.name: Sarah Mitchell
victim.background: Investigative journalist working on exposing corruption in city government. Was about to publish a major story.

victim.name: Detective James Rodriguez
victim.background: Police detective investigating both previous deaths. Started connecting them as part of a pattern.

suspects.name: Alex Tanaka
suspects.motive: Believes they're creating a better world by eliminating corrupt people through cyber means. Started after their parent died due to corporate negligence. Self-taught hacker with deep knowledge of IoT vulnerabilities.

alibi.statement: I had therapy sessions until 8pm, then met my friend Lisa at the coffee shop. Got home around 9:30pm, read for a bit, then went to sleep around 11pm.

suspects.name: Dr. Elena Volkov
suspects.motive: Had access to patient records showing victims' crimes. Treated some of the victims' past victims for trauma. Has written extensively about justice and morality.

alibi.statement: I had sessions until 8pm, including one emergency call. Grabbed dinner alone downtown to think. Got home around 10pm and worked on my research about justice psychology.

suspects.name: Victor Kane
suspects.motive: Was hired by victims' families to investigate corruption. Has connections to criminal underworld. Grudge against corrupt officials after being forced off the force.

timeline.activity: Following a lead on Marcus Chen

alibi.statement: I was tailing Marcus Chen earlier, then watched Sarah Mitchell's office building. Met my informant at O'Malley's around 8pm. Got home by 10:30pm, my wife can confirm.

suspects.name: Maya Ishikawa
suspects.motive: Her startup was nearly destroyed by Marcus Chen's legal maneuvering. Lost millions. Has advanced tech knowledge and resources. Her security AI could potentially track and manipulate systems.

timeline.activity: Team meeting about AI security product

alibi.statement: Worked late on our AI security product, trying to fix a critical bug before our investor demo. Finally hit the gym around 10pm, got home just before midnight.

evidence.name: Marcus Chen Autopsy Report
evidence.description: Death by cardiac arrest. No signs of forced entry or struggle. Victim appeared to die instantly around 10pm.

evidence.name: Victim's Computer Search History
evidence.description: Browser history shows searches for 'heart attack symptoms' and 'sudden cardiac death' from an unknown device on the local network 30 minutes before death.

evidence.name: Prescription Bottle
evidence.description: Empty prescription bottle for nitroglycerin (heart medication) found in trash. Victim had no heart condition.

evidence.name: Sarah Mitchell Autopsy Report
evidence.description: Cyanide poisoning. Death occurred rapidly, between 7pm-8pm. Poison was in her coffee.

evidence.name: Coffee Cup
evidence.description: Victim's coffee cup contained traces of cyanide. Cup was from office break room. No fingerprints except victim's.

evidence.name: Office Building CCTV
evidence.description: Footage shows Victor Kane entering the building at 7:00pm and leaving at 7:20pm. He did not go to victim's floor according to elevator logs.

evidence.name: Office Network Logs
evidence.description: Unknown device accessed building WiFi from 6:45pm-7:15pm. Device spoofed MAC address but logged near victim's office.

evidence.name: Detective Rodriguez Autopsy Report
evidence.description: Multiple contusions consistent with fall from height. Death occurred around 11pm. Small puncture wound on neck suggests possible sedative injection before fall.

evidence.name: Partial Footprint
evidence.description: Partial boot print found at scene, size 10. Matches common hiking boot brand. Victor Kane wears size 10 boots.

evidence.name: Bridge Traffic Camera
evidence.description: Camera shows no vehicles near bridge 10:30pm-11:30pm. However, footage has a 5-minute gap at 11:05pm-11:10pm due to 'technical malfunction'.

contradictions.description: Victor Kane was at Sarah Mitchell's office building at the time of her death (7pm), as confirmed by CCTV. He claims he was doing surveillance but has no proof of who hired him.
Victor Kane's boot size matches the partial footprint at the bridge (size 10). His alibi at 11pm claims he was home, but his wife has been known to cover for him in past cases.
Victor was investigating Marcus Chen earlier that day. As a former cop with underworld connections, he has the skills to stage deaths as accidents or natural causes.
Victor's informant at the bar claims Victor left around 9:30pm, not 10:30pm as stated. This gives him a 1-hour window unaccounted for during Marcus Chen's death.

Maya Ishikawa's company specializes in AI security systems capable of hacking networks and spoofing devices. Unknown devices appeared at two murder scenes with sophisticated spoofing - matching her company's capabilities.

Maya was working late 'testing security algorithms' with no witnesses at 9pm-11pm. Her AI security product specifically includes camera system vulnerabilities - explaining the bridge camera tampering.
Maya's company had a failed deal with a pharmaceutical company. Internal emails show she researched heart medication vulnerabilities for a 'product demo' weeks before Marcus Chen's death.
Dr. Volkov had 'emergency session' at 7pm with no witnesses - same time as Sarah Mitchell's poisoning. She also researches justice psychology and has written about 'necessary evil' in her papers.
Dr. Volkov has extensive knowledge of poisons and sedatives from her psychiatric practice. Was alone at home during Detective Rodriguez's death with no witnesses.
Dr. Volkov's research papers discuss 'removing harmful elements from society' for the greater good. She had treated victims of crimes committed by all three murder victims.
Alex Tanaka's roommate could potentially have helped with city IT access, but there's no evidence they did. Roommate confirms Alex was home watching TV.
Alex has a background in counseling victims of corporate crimes, including people harmed by Marcus Chen's legal work. Strong emotional motive.
Alex's friend 'Lisa' who supposedly met them at coffee shop at 8pm cannot be located for verification. No CCTV footage confirms this meeting.

metadata.notes: Tutorial case demonstrating alibi contradictions, digital evidence, and pattern recognition.
